column5: A reminder to everyone to hug your family members as much as possible. My buddy Josh who you have seen in quite a few reports lost his father unexpectedly last week and received a phone call today saying that his mother has passed away. He is only 22 and I can't even imagine what he is going through.
Terrible news about your friend Dan.  My wifes mother also passed away 2 days ago.
very sorry ta here about both your losses and your right lifes short hug your family.  Hawg Hunter
It might be a good time to hug your Bud as well, Dan.  Lew, I'm sorry to hear of Diane's mother. I humbly offer my condolences.
This is not a good month, quite a number have lost family and close friends, sorry and condolences for both of you,  your friend Josh and Lews mom in law.
Very sorry to here of his Loss and also to Diane and Lew time is to short and we for sure will not regret the time we spent with my folks or my wife's.  our thoughts go out to both famlies
Condolences to all and give Diane a hug for us Lew.  Both parents in a week is unthinkable Dan. As for being 22...  I was 23 when my father went.
Thats horrible.... My condolences all around, thats to much for anyone to bare.

So tragic - I can't imagine what Josh is going through - hopefully there are siblings otherwise he truly will feel like an orphan....that's where good friends become 'family'. My sincere condolences and to you as well Lew.
My heart goes out to your friend, and Lew, my condolences go to your wife and the rest of the family, it is only 3 months today that I lost my father.  FLEX

Wow. That is terrible news Dan, both parents in a week, cannot imagine what he is going through. My condolences to Josh and his family and friends.  Lew - My condolences to you and Diane and her family as well.

Very good advice to hug your parents. Often and at every opportunity.  When I was a young buck, my Dad was the dopiest dude I knew but somehow, the older I got, the wiser he got.  That's likely not the way it really happened but it seemed like it at the time.  Yeah, I was a serious rebel and a black sheep for a long time and don't know why Dad ever let me in his house but I saw the light eventually and realised what was really for real.  He was a smart guy and he loved me.  When he retired and moved here to Elliot Lake, we got real close.  We fished together and hunted together just like brothers or best friends.  Lost my Dad in 93.  Lost my Mom in 03.  Got to hug them lots in the later years and I take consolation from that.  A lot of you know that I run a karaoke business and one of the best nights I can remember is dancing with Mom and singing her favourite song to her at the same time.  It was about a week before she died and the song was "Unchained Melody".  Hug your parents and your good friends often.

My sincere condolences, dan and lew. In the past month or so I lost 2 friends,and almost another childhood friend around christmass time.Really makes you think!All were young as well! Hug your mother!Give your best friend a hug as well!
Lew...Sorry to hear about Dianne's mom...Give her a hug for us...  Dan...Like Roy said..."give your buddy a hug...(nothing unmanly about doing that!)...
Both parents a week apart ???????? Wow.... that has got to be tough. I dont even know what to say, My condolences !
